episode_title: 308 - The One With The Giant Poking Device

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there, Rachel is serving brownies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here you go Pheebs. Who else wants one of my special homemade brownies?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I will have one. (Ross and him both take one.)
(Phoebe takes a bite and spits it out and screams.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’m not gonna have one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Neither will I. (they both put back the brownies.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, it’s just my tooth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right I’ll have one. (he and Ross take another brownie,)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what’s a matter, you need a dentist? I’ve got a good one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No thanks, I have a good one too. I just, I, I can’t see him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See that is the problem with invisible dentists.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why? Why can’t you go to him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because, every time I go to the dentist, somebody dies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is so weird, because every time I go to the dentist, I look down the hygienist’s blouse.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, what? Umm…what?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah, first there was my aunt Mary, and then there was umm, John, my mailman, and then my, my cowboy friend ‘Albino Bob’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And all these people actually died?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, while I was in the chair! That’s why I take such good care of my teeth now, y’know, it’s not about oral hygiene, I floss to save lives!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, come on, you didn’t kill anybody, these people just happened to die when you went to the dentist. It’s, it’s, it’s just ah, a coincidence.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well tell that to them. Oh! You can’t, their dead.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks, Gunther. (takes the plate Gunther serves him and Rachel comes up and kisses him) (to Rachel) Hey! (to Gunther) Umm, can I get a napkin too?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, like you don’t already have everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ow! Ow! (drops the apple in disgust.)
content.parenthetical: trying to bite into an apple

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, your in pain, would you just go to the dentist, just go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, fine, fine, but if you’re my next victim, don’t come back as a poltergeist and like suck me into the TV set.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I promise.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Although, don’t feel like you can’t visit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, is, is, is Chandler here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no he’s not.
content.parenthetical: patting his clothes like he is looking for his wallet

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys, Joey just saw Janice kissing her ex-husband.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (to Joey) So what are you going to do? I mean how, how are you going to tell Chandler?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was thinking about that and I, I think the best way would be, to not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you can’t keep this to yourself, if you know about this, you have to tell him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’ll kill him. I mean it’ll, it’ll just kill him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you could wait ‘til I go to the dentist, maybe I’ll kill him.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, All are there except for Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ewww! Ugly Naked Guy is using his new hammock. It’s like a Play-Doo Fat Factory.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m going to the dentist, so listen, okay, just be on the look out for anything that, that, that you can fall into, or, or that can fall on you, or… All right, just look out! Okay, And um, I also just wanna, I just wanna tell you all that um… (starts to cry and runs out)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I have a problem I have to go into work for a few hours, some kids messed up the Homo Sapien display.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What did they do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, they painted over the word ‘Sapien’ for one thing, then they rearranged the figures, let’s just leave it at that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, do you want me to watch Ben for you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, that’s what I was going to ask, thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! Wait! Hello! What about me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You? You! Want to watch Ben? (in the background Monica mouths ‘Don’t worry, I’ll be here the whole time.’ to Ross.) Yes! That’d be great, no, I just wanted to ask Monica, because I know how empty her life is. (Monica sarcastically mouths ‘Yeah!’ and holds up her thumb.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve got a science question.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If the Homo Sapiens, were in fact ‘Homo-sapien’, is that why there extinct?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, Homo Sapiens are people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, I’m not judging.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are babysitting Ben.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Benny, spoon. (moves it back and forth) Spoon. Come on! All right, y’know what I think he’s bored.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here. Ben, do you wanna play the airplane game, do you wanna show Rachel? Come here. (takes Ben) We’re gonna do something fun. Okay. (throws Ben up in the air a little bit and catches him) Weee!! (moves into the living room and does it again) Weee!! (starts to walk back into the kitchen as she does it again, and hits Ben’s head on that wooden beam across the ceiling.)
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who’s so brave, you’re so brave, yes you are, you’re so brave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay honey, he’s fine, he’s fine, let’s just put him down. Come here, Ben. (sets him on the couch) See that’s a good boy. (to Monica) How could you do that to him!! Ross trusted me, what is he going to say?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s not gonna say anything, because we’re not gonna tell him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re not?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No we’re not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I like that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So we’re okay, we’re okay, we’re okay, (starts to exam Ben) aren’t we? No, we’re not okay, we’re not okay, there’s a bump, there’s a bump.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Well push it in! Push it in!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot push it in!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, we’re gonna need a distraction.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The second that Ross walks in that door, I want you take him back to your bedroom and do whatever it is that you do that makes him go, (high pitched) rweee!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Or. We could put a hat on his head.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A hat! Yes! We need a hat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We need a hat..

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where are we gonna find a tiny little hat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh, oh, I’ll get ‘Rainy Day Bear’!! (runs to get him)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because he’ll know what to do? (Rachel comes out of her room with a bear that’s dressed in a rain suit.) Oh my God, you’re a genius!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, oh God, it’s sowed on though.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give it. Give it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(Monica takes the bear, grabs his hat, and rips off his head.)

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: Oh!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s just like a bloodbath in here today.

content.description: The street, Chandler and Joey are walking past a jewelery store.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Hold on a minute, hold on a second. Do you think these pearls are nice?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d really prefer a mountain bike.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice’s birthday is coming up, I want to get her something speacial. Come in here with me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, whoa. Do you ah, want to get her something speacial, get her flowers, get her candy, get her gum, girls love gum.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a good idea, ‘Dear Janice have a Hubba-Bubba birthday’. I would like to get her something serious.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you want something serious. Y’know what you should do, you should get her one of those um, barium enemas. Those are dead serious.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. Look, I’m gonna go in here, and you don’t buy me anything ever. (starts to go into the store)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, you can’t, you can’t, okay, you can’t, you can’t buy her pearls, you just can’t, you can’t, you can’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh God. Uh, okay, here’s the thing, this is the thing, okay, the thing is…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is the thing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. I went down to the ‘Mattress King’ showroom and, and I saw Janice, kissing her ex-husband.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They were in his office.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well she, she wouldn’t do that, she’s with, she’s with me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m telling you man, I saw it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, you’re wrong! Okay, you’re wrong.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not wrong! I wish I was. I’m sorry. Bet that barium enema doesn’t sound so bad now, huh?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are dressing up Ben in the entire rain suit from Rainy Day Bear.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It just makes more sense as an ensemble.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Besides, it takes the focus off the hat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Oh! You’re alive! You’re alive!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See Pheebs, I promised you no one would die, didn’t I?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, we’ll see about that. Can I use your phone? I just wanna call everyone I know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure, we have no money, go ahead.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Hey! You’re not dead! Okay, see ya!’

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! He just said my name! Did you hear that?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Monica bang!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I heard that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did he just say ‘Monica bang’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! He’s gonna rat me out!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Monica bang!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-ho-ho, sweetie, sweetie, you gotta stop saying that, now. It’s no big deal, it’s not even worth mentioning, you see we all do it all the time. See watch this, Ben, Ben, Ben. (goes over and starts hitting her head on the post) Ow, Monica bang! (does it again) Everybody bang. (repeats) Ben bang. (repeats) Rachel bang. (repeats) Bang, Rachel bang! Oh, isn’t that fun?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at that! (repeats) Look at that! (repeats) We all do it. (repeats) Okay, I’m stopping now.
content.parenthetical: goes over and hits her head on the post

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! Y’know, if it’s not a headboard, it’s just not worth it.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is waiting for Janice to arrive, and is angrily fllipping through a magazine.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: How’s my Bing-a-ling?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, I don’t know, you tell me. Anything you ah, wanna tell me, because, if you ah, you should, if you, you would, tell me.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Why are your eyes so white?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You tell me! Maybe, it’s because I was just fooling with my ex! Oh no-no-no-no, no-no-no-no, that was you!!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: How did you know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey told me, he saw you two kissing.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: In the park?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! In his office! How many kisses were there?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Just those two!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wh-wh-why, wh-why, why, why was there kissing!? There should be no kissing!!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry honey, I’m so, so, (nasally) haaaaa! I’m so, so sorry, I just (nasally) haaaaaa! But I, oh what happened was, I-I-I can’t breathe. Can you get me a bag, or something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here.
(Janice starts to breath into it and sucks in the reciept, and then spits it out.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: The receipt.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll take it! All right look, I gotta know. Are you finished with me? (Janice shakes her head no) Are you finished with him? (Janice shakes her head no) Do you still love him? (Janice shakes her head yes) Do you still love me? (Janice shakes her head yes) All right look, (grabs the bag) I’m gonna need an actual answer here okay, so which is it, him or me? (his phone starts to ring)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. If you’re alive you answer your phone!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Ben, I won’t tell your daddy that you had ice cream for dinner, if you don’t tell about our little bonking incident.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, number one, I don’t think Ben understands the concept of bribery, and number two, I… (Joey starts laughing in the background) (to Joey) What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You said number two.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I also said number one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. (giggles harder)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Everyone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’s my little boy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s perfect, he’s never been better.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’d you do, take him whaling?
content.parenthetical: noticing the outfit he is wearing

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, he just said your name, that’s great! Good job Ben.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Monica bang!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s right, that’s what I’d sound like if I exploded.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Woo-Hoo! The curse is broken! I called everybody I know, and everyone is alive.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ugly Naked Guy looks awfully still. (Phoebe runs to the window and gasps.)
[Cut to later, all except Chandler are staring out the window at Ugly Naked Guy.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I killed him! I killed another one! And this curse is getting stronger too, to bring down something that big.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well maybe he’s just taking a nap.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m tellin’ ya, he hasn’t moved since this morning.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, we should call somebody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And tell them what? The naked guy we stare at all the time isn’t moving.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we have gotta find out if he’s alive.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How are we gonna do that? There’s no way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there is one way. His window’s open, I say, we poke him.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is throwing darts, as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Y’know how we ah, save all those chopsticks for no reason we get when we get Chinese food?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, now we got a reason.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we’re fashioning a very long poking device.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey uh, what’s a matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I talked to Janice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God, is she going back to him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She doesn’t know. Says she loves us both. Y’know I woke up this morning and I was in love, well I was happy. Y’know it serves me right for buying that twelve pack of condoms. And now I can’t even return them, because she choked on the reciept!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you ah, what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, y’know. What, what, would you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it doesn’t matter what I would do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, tell me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, you’re probably not gonna want to hear this but ah, if it was me, and this is just me, (Chandler gets ready to throw another dart) I would ah, I would bow out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? (turns around quickly still ready to throw the dart and Joey quickly ducks and hides behind the chair) What are you, what are you talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They have a kid together, y’know. They’re like, they’re like a family, and if, I don’t know, there’s chance they could make that work, I know I wouldn’t want to be the guy who stood in the way of that. Are you okay? Do you wanna ah, come poke a nude guy?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross has just finished putting Ben to sleep, and is entering from Rachel’s room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, he’s finally alseep. About that ah, bump on his head?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you, are you, are you sure it’s ah, a new bump? I mean, no offense, I’ve always thought of Ben as a fairly bumpy headed child.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s okay if he bumps his head, kids bump their heads all the time, y’know, it was your first time babysitting, I figured you did the best you could.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know! I’m saying you have to watch them all the time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did!! I watched! I watched! I watched Monica bang his head against that thing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica did it?
(Monica runs into the kitchen from the terrace.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, did you notice anything wierd about Ben today?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I was just playing with him, and y’know we were doing the alphabet song, which he used to be really good at, but suddenly he’s leaving out ‘e’ and ‘f.’ It’s like they just ah, I don’t know, fell out of his head.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, and also, he’s, he’s walkin’ kind of funny, his left leg is moving a lot faster than his right leg, and he’s in there just sort of y’know… (walks around in a circle)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, I wrecked your baby!! (runs into the bedroom)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I hope it’s still funny when you’re in hell.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You jerk! You know how much I love that kid! (starts to chase Ross around the living room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica bang! Monica bang! (runs into one of the posts) Ow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll get the hat.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Janice are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice, I have something I need to tell you, and I want you to let me get through it, because it’s, it’s, it’s not gonna be easy.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think you should go back with Gary. I don’t wanna be the guy that breaks up a family, y’know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy. Whenever I would see him I was always think y’know ‘You’re the reason, you are the reason why their not together.’ and I hated that guy. And it didn’t matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well. It’s the right thing to do.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh! You’re right. Oh God. But, before I can say ‘good-bye’, there’s something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, it’s like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie’s been singing about. Y’know, I mean what we have, it’s like movie love, you’re my soulmate, and I can’t believe we’re not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then don’t leave me!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-I’ve got to give my marriage another chance.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No you don’t! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce another chance.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I’m sorry. (hugs him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohhh. Don’t go.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesn’t let her go.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No! No! No!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Honey, honey, people are looking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I don’t care!!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Yeah, um, I’m, I’m leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of Chandler’s grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can’t leave! I have your shoe!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Rachel has those in burgendy.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the giant poking device.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can we please focus here, a naked man’s life hangs in the balance!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m telling you he’s dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, ladies and gentlemen, let’s poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we’re approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.
(They thread the needle and start poking him, he then stirs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s alive! He’s a-live!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And yet, we’re still poking him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, retract the device, retract the device.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He does not look happy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey-hey, now he’s showing us his poking device.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, that’s never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is listening to a Lionel Richie album

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘I’ll hold you close in my arms. (Phoebe enters) I can’t resist your charms. And love…’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Love…’

content.speaker: Chandler and Phoebe
content.text: ‘I’ll be a fool for you. I’m sure, you know I don’t mind.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘No you know I don’t mind.’

content.speaker: Chandler and Phoebe
content.text: ‘Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh..’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘I know.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘I know.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘I’ve found.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘I’ve found…’

content.speaker: Chandler and Phoebe
content.text: ‘…in you, my endless (Phoebe goes high pitched, Chandler goes low pitched) love.’ (they both look at each other.) ‘My endless love.’ (once again they don’t match tones, and they just look at each other)
